intro: Pedicularis euphrasioides var. simplex, commonly known as the simple beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its tubular, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense spikes. This variety is distinguished by its simpler floral structure compared to other varieties of Pedicularis.
